import React, { Component } from 'react' import TopNav from './../../../../navbar/Topnav' import Sidebar from './../../../../navbar/SideBar' import FormValidator from './../../../../../utils/Validator'; class AddChiefExecutive extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.validator = new FormValidator([ { field: 'fname', method: 'isEmpty', validWhen: false, message: 'First Name is required.' }, { field: 'lname', method: 'isEmpty', validWhen: false, message: 'Last Name is required.' } ]); this.state = { fname: '', lname: '', uname: '', gender:'', email: '', phone: '', dob: '', doj: '', password: '', password_confirmation: '', validation: this.validator.valid(), } this.submitted = false; } inputChange = event => { event.preventDefault(); this.setState({ [ event.target.name ] : event.target.value }) console.log(this.state) } createUser = event => { event.preventDefault(); const validation = this.validator.validate(this.state); this.setState({ validation }); this.submitted = true; } render() { let validation = this.submitted ? // if the form has been submitted at least once this.validator.validate(this.state) : // then check validity every time we render this.state.validation // otherwise just use what's in state return (
Add Chief Executive


{validation.fname.message}
{validation.lname.message}
) } } export default AddChiefExecutive
